title: 2-week ban for inting with the permission of his team
body:
Just wanted to let ya'll know about a situation that can get you banned, that's entirely annoying and stupid.

My partner played a norm with one close friend, and three randos that he met and had been playing a few games with. In this particular game he played rammus, and every single person in his team TOLD him to try and int to 100 deaths. Because they "were tired of stomping so hard in every game" --> one of their words exactly.
Despite this, they were asses and 2 of them reported him as well as the entire enemy team.

The in-game chat logs prove he had their blessing, yet the guy that reviewed his ban still said the ban was justified.

So.. be careful who you int with, even if they tell you to you can still get in trouble for it (absolutely stupid)

replies.body:
If it was a custom it would be different, but given that this was done in a norm, old mate more than likely had a rather negative effect on the *enemy* team's experience. In ranked people will take a free win for the LP, but in normals, wins are comparatively meaningless. It's the fun that matters and getting a free win rather sucks the fun out.

Given that he didn't have *their* blessing, I would imagine that is the justification for the ban standing.

asking enemies first if you can tilt meta??? -.- e.g Karth maxed E aoe  (using passive WELL) to carry but never gets kills so he doesn't feed or straight up kill carry if delete mode, Sion, support, and tank etc. Rank is meaningless too with the amount of boosters if it wasn't for the reward system
Playing off-meta (even when picking something that is unlikely to be effective) is a vastly different beast than straight-up intentionally feeding.

but she/he said they gave permission in norms too and here ya go! https://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-history/NA1/44237418?champion=30 + https://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-history/NA1/44237418?champion=14 (way more wins as dps instead of tanking or supporting for people who hate me or don't even wait for pokes to whittle enemies first when it suits). The allies that lied should have a tally, no better than trolls that ks with full mana nearly all game or ones that pretend to follow up only to run off when you're in the thick of it

In ranked people will take a free win for the LP, but in normals, wins are comparatively meaningless. It's the fun that matters and getting a free win rather sucks the fun out.

You can still get banned for inting in a custom game. You can get banned for inting in a coop vs ai game.

Yes but if you did it in a custom and had a chat log proving that all parties agreed that would be a valid defence. If OP had only been reported by *their* team in this case they may have also had a strong enough defence to warrant a warning and removal of the ban (which a co-op vs Ai would also fall into the category of).

As it is, they clearly had a negative impact on the enemy team, who did not agree prior to the game to the terms OP and his team were setting.

I'm not saying it's not a grey area, because it is, but ultimately, our actions affect the enemy team as well even if it's generally to a lesser extent. They do deserve consideration given that they were stuck with a negative situation they had no reason to expect. 

I can understand and respect both the argument for removal and the argument for the punishment remaining, but personally with the inforrmation available I do lean the way that Support ultimately went. Mostly though, the point of my comment was to explain the why.
enemy teams totally complain about free wins/gold
